title: Front of Head of Dionysos
description:
Votive is from the region of Campania (southern Italy). Fragment of either grave offering or votive. Softly modeled, with voluminous cirls framing face and supporting left forearm. May be from front half of bivalve mold. 

Though piece was purportedly found on island of Capri, other batch members' similarity to Hellenistic finds from Paestum shrine and fragment's own slight resemblance to terracotta head from site justify broader attribution.
